item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 13, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Starship Flight 5: Launch and booster catch [video] (1325 points | 818 comments)
2. Refurb weekend: the Symbolics MacIvory Lisp machine I have hated (17 points | 2 comments)
3. Making the Tibetan language a first-class citizen in the digital world (103 points | 44 comments)
4. The quiet art of attention (231 points | 86 comments)
5. Show HN: The fastest Ethereum graph explorer (OpenSource) (25 points | discuss)
6. The military is an impossible place for hackers, and what to do about it (2018) (50 points | 30 comments)
7. A Dictionary of Single-Letter Variable Names (30 points | 20 comments)
8. CRLF is obsolete and should be abolished (184 points | 93 comments)
9. All asteroids in Solar System, visualized (14 points | discuss)
10. Diffusion for World Modeling (382 points | 182 comments)
11. A novel channel contention mechanism for improving wi-fi's reliability (64 points | 25 comments)
12. Common Lisp implementation of the Forth 2012 Standard (87 points | 47 comments)
13. Lessons learned from profiling an algorithm in Rust (85 points | 11 comments)
14. Node.js, Pipes, and Disappearing Bytes (52 points | 27 comments)
15. Ward Christensen (of BBS and XMODEM fame) has died (165 points | 34 comments)
16. Restic: Backups done right (112 points | 54 comments)
17. Plop Boot Manager (3 points | 2 comments)
18. Starship is Still Not Understood (2021) (19 points | 7 comments)
19. Catastrophically warm predictions are more plausible than we thought (16 points | discuss)
20. Large language models reduce public knowledge sharing on online Q&A platforms (302 points | 262 comments)
21. Exploring Typst, a new typesetting system similar to LaTeX (503 points | 198 comments)
22. Even a Single Bacterial Cell Can Sense the Seasons Changing (26 points | 10 comments)
23. Interview with Yann LeCun on AI (43 points | 46 comments)
24. The Optimus robots at Tesla's Cybercab event were humans in disguise (61 points | 41 comments)
25. Show HN: I've added undo and redo to IsoCity (20 points | 8 comments)
26. Christopher Columbus may have been Spanish and Jewish, documentary says (16 points | 55 comments)
27. America's new millionaire class: Plumbers and HVAC entrepreneurs (73 points | 96 comments)
28. Can logic programming be liberated from predicates and backtracking? [pdf] (168 points | 58 comments)
29. ACF Plugin no longer available on WordPress.org (149 points | 72 comments)
30. Pepsi’s Soviet Navy (2021) (56 points | 16 comments)
